intro: Calochortus weedii, commonly known as the Sierra daffodil, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as meadows and hillsides. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a single stem that supports its vibrant blooms. Calochortus weedii is a member of the Liliaceae family and is often found in California and Nevada.
